intro: Scaevola humilis, commonly known as the common scaevola, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink or blue. The plant has a sprawling habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments. Scaevola humilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
